snippet: Teachers are scrambling to educate students without the classrooms they need and with no prospect of new ones being built anytime soon, as people move back.
abstract: Schools in Las Vegas are so overcrowded that 13 of them stay open 12 months a year, children go to classes and eat lunch in cramped, windowless trailers and thousands more take online classes at home; situation is evidence that economy has rebounded from the economic downturn, but growth is overwhelming both teachers and parents alike.
lead_paragraph: Teachers are scrambling to educate students without the classrooms they need and with no prospect of new ones being built anytime soon, as people move back.

headline.main: Las Vegas Schools Groan From Growing Pains
headline.print_headline: Las Vegas Schools Groan From Growing Pains
